IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: SERVES MEMBERS AND CREATES A HIGH QUALITY VISITOR EXPERIENCE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE UNION SQUARE ALLIANCE SERVES ITS MEMBERS AND CREATES A HIGH-QUALITY, COMPLETE NEIGHBORHOOD EXPERIENCE BY MANAGING AND ACTIVATING PUBLIC SPACES; SUPPORTING EXISTING BUSINESSES AND ATTRACTING NEW INVESTMENTS; AND CONVENING, PARTNERING, AND ADVOCATING FOR THE DISTRICT'S FUTURE SUCCESS.
IRS990.Desc: CLEAN & SAFE SERVICES:THE UNION SQUARE ALLIANCE (ALLIANCE) PROPOSES TO ENHANCE THE EXPERIENCE OF VISITORS TO THE AREA BY PROVIDING CLEAN AND SAFE SERVICES. CLEANING SERVICES INCLUDE MAINTENANCE WORKERS PROVIDING DAILY REFUSE PICKUP, SIDEWALK SWEEPING, PRESSURE WASHING ALL SIDEWALKS, TRASH RECEPTACLE CONTROL, GRAFFITI REMOVAL AND ILLEGAL DUMPING ABATEMENT. SAFE SERVICES INCLUDE HIRING OF SFPD OFFICERS AND HIRING OF 24/7 PRIVATE SECURITY PATROLS EACH DAY AND SAFETY AND HOSPITALITY AMBASSADORS TO PATROL THE AREA AND HELP VISITORS. THE ALLIANCE ALSO TRAINS AMBASSADORS IN SOCIAL SERVICES TO DIRECT THOSE IN NEED TO CITY SERVICES AND RESOURCES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: PUBLIC REALM IMPROVEMENTS, MARKETING & EVENTS, ADVOCACY:PUBLIC REALM PROGRAMS INCLUDE IMPROVEMENTS LIKE LANDSCAPING, SIGNAGE, LIGHTING, HOLIDAY DECOR AND ACTIVATING PUBLIC SPACE. ADVOCACY INCLUDES PROMOTING A CLEAN, SAFE AND VIBRANT DISTRICT TO ASSURE A GOOD EXPERIENCE FOR THE VISITORS, RESIDENTS AND EMPLOYEES. ADVOCACY GIVES THE DISTRICT A SINGLE VOICE IN MATTERS THAT MAY AFFECT THE MEMBERS. MARKETING INCLUDES PRODUCTION OF WEBSITE AND SOCIAL MEDIA PAGES FOR VISITORS, RESIDENTS AND MEMBERS, PRODUCTION OF WELCOME KITS AND COLLATERAL FOR MERCHANTS AND MEMBERS, GUIDES AND MAPS OF THE DISTRICT, SPECIAL EVENTS AND CAMPAIGNS TO DRAW VISITORS TO THE AREA.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: UNION SQUARE PARK:THE ALLIANCE PROVIDED SCHEDULED AND DEDICATED CLEANING AND SAFETY SERVICES TO UNION SQUARE PARK. IN ADDITION, THE ALLIANCE PROVIDED EVENT SETUP AND ASSISTANCE FOR GROUPS HOLDING EVENTS IN THE PARK. THE ALLIANCE ALSO PROVIDED REGULAR PROGRAMMING IN THE PARK.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule L, Part V Supplemental Information
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORMER EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, KARIN FLOOD, HAD AN OWNERSHIP INTEREST IN THE BUILDING WHERE UNION SQUARE BUSINESS IMPROVEMENT DISTRICT SIGNED A LEASE COMMENCING IN SEPTEMBER 2020 AND PAID APPROXIMATELY $83,980 DURING THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30,2023.

OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 4: UNION SQUARE PARK:THE ALLIANCE PROVIDED SCHEDULED AND DEDICATED CLEANING AND SAFETY SERVICES TO UNION SQUARE PARK. IN ADDITION, THE ALLIANCE PROVIDED EVENT SETUP AND ASSISTANCE FOR GROUPS HOLDING EVENTS IN THE PARK. THE ALLIANCE ALSO PROVIDED REGULAR PROGRAMMING IN THE PARK.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: JULIE TAYLOR, A BOARD MEMBER, HAD A BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP WITH SEVERAL OTHER BOARD MEMBERS.THE FORMER EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, KARIN FLOOD, HAD AN OWNERSHIP INTEREST IN THE BUILDING WHERE THE ALLIANCE SIGNED A LEASE COMMENCING IN SEPTEMBER 2020.A MEMBER OF THE ALLIANCE'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS ASSOCIATED WITH A COMPANY THAT CONTRIBUTED SERVICES TO THE ALLIANCE TOTALING $314,000 DURING THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2023.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PROPERTY OWNERS IN THE DISTRICT ARE MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PROPERTY OWNERS GET TO VOTE ON THE ELECTION OF BOARD MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MEMBERS SHALL HAVE THE RIGHT TO VOTE ON THE ELECTION OF DIRECTORS, ON ANY MERGER AND ITS PRINCIPAL TERMS AND ANY AMENDMENT OF THOSE TERMS, AND ON ANY ELECTION TO DISSOLVE THE CORPORATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FINANCE COMMITTEE REVIEWS A DRAFT OF THE FEDERAL FORM 990. THE FINANCE COMMITTEE THEN PRESENTS THE DRAFT 990 COPY TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO BOARD MEETING AND MAKES COPIES AVAILABLE AT THE BOARD MEETING. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS VOTES TO APPROVE THE 990 BEFORE FILING WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH YEAR ALL BOARD MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO REVIEW AND UPDATE THEIR CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORMS AND LIST ANY CONFLICTS. BOARD MEMBERS THEN RECUSE THEMSELVES IN VOTES OR DISCUSSIONS WHERE THEY MAY HAVE A CONFLICT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE SALARY OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND STAFF OF THE ORGANIZATION EACH YEAR AND COMPARES SALARIES TO SALARY SURVEY INFORMATION AND PUBLICLY AVAILABLE SALARY DATA AND ADJUSTS SALARIES AS NECESSARY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL ORGANIZATION POLICIES ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
